Title: Software Engineering - AWS Security
Job_Description:
As a Junior level J2EE Software Engineer, you will provide high quality technology solutions that address business needs by developing applications within mature technology environments. Perform full life cycle design and development for the Operations Technology Applications. You will be responsible for the following:
Perform hands-on development for defects and new features
Assist with defect resolution during system testing and user acceptance testing
Partner with L2 and assist in incident resolution as needed
Create implementation plans and back out plans
Oversee implementations and post-implementation support phases
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

Title: Software Engineering - AWS Security
Job_Description:
As an experienced Software Engineer, you will work in a dynamic, agile team to enhance, build, and deliver trusted market-leading technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. Depending on the team that you join, you could be developing mobile features that give our customers and clients more control over how they bank with us, strategizing on how big data can make our trading systems quicker, creating the next innovation in payments for merchants, or supporting the integration of our private and public cloud platforms.
Your Role and Responsibilities

Participate in design and develop scalable and resilient systems in a timely manner using Java or Python and JavaScript to contribute to continual, iterative improvements for product teams
Design, write, comment and unit test code to confirm software modules are of the highest quality





JPMorgan Chase is looking to hire Associate Software Engineers at the 601 and 602 levels. A determination will be made on placement for successful candidates based on the results of a skills-based assessment which applicants will be asked to complete during the hiring process. The assessment will evaluate ability to perform basic coding and systems design responsibilities. For the 601 level, the role requires the ability to understand advance features of a coding language, design a viable system, and solve functional problems through basic language applications. For the 602 level, the role requires a higher level of proficiency and ability to function independently, including the ability to use and explain advance features of a coding language, design systems across technologies and platforms, solve functional and non-functional problems through an application of language best practices, as well as, the ability to assess issues broadly, identify alternative or innovative solutions, collaborate effectively, and provide guidance to others.

Visa sponsorship may be available for these positions.

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

Be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that engineers the large-scale, complex and resilient technology solutions that drive our global business. When you work at JPMorgan Chase, you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. Title: Software Engineering - AWS Security
Job_Description:
2023 SOFTWARE ENGINEER PROGRAM - FULL-TIME OPPORTUNITY
JPMorgan Chase & Co. is proud to be a corporate sponsor of the 2022 AFROTECH conference, and we are excited to meet - and hire - some of the brightest minds in tech at the conference. We invite qualified candidates who will participate in this year's conference to apply.

Be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that engineers the large-scale, complex and resilient technology solutions that drive our global business. This program will allow you to help build and optimize digital applications and systems that support millions of customers, clients and employees worldwide.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase, you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. Across our global technology centers, our team of more than 50,000 technologists design, build, deploy and run everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning and cloud development. As a firm, we're partnering with FinTech and Silicon Valley tech firms to deliver cutting-edge solutions to our clients and customers. Our $12 billion annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.





Locations you may join in the United States:



If you're ready to put your passion for technology to work in a way that makes a real difference, you'll find your place in our Software Engineer Program.

Key skills include:

To be eligible for this program, you must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a permanent basis. We do not offer any type of employment-based immigration sponsorship for this program. Likewise, JPMorgan Chase & Co., will not provide any assistance or sign any documentation in support of any other form of immigration sponsorship or benefit including optional practical training (OPT) or curricular practical training (CPT.)



At JPMorgan Chase, we're creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career.

We value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.



Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume and location preference. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it's important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.

After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you'll receive an email invitation to complete a coding challenge powered by HackerRank. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.

HackerRank is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed this step. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.

Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.

UI/UX designers, engineers, business developers, graphics designers, user experience research, user strategy, project managers, copywriters and other creative professionals comprise the teams within our organization. These professionals are responsible for delivering unique and innovative designs and experiences across multiple applications, products and payments offerings. Diverse backgrounds of the team range across design agencies, mobile handset manufacturers, financial institutions, mobile carriers, startups and content providers.
This software engineering role requires strong technical and communication skills along with a customer-centric point of view. The ability to work closely with UX designers, product, researchers, and other engineers to deliver robust and scalable products is critical to your success in this role.

Work with designers and other engineers to build state-of-the-art web- and mobile-based systems

The team's current focus is on modernization of legacy Retirement Experience applications and building in new functionality for future releases. Title: Full Stack Engineer
Job_Description:
Title:
Fullstack Software Engineer (Java, React, REST/Microservices, Spring Boot) - Trading

Short Description for Internal Candidates

In our Software Engineering Group, we look for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices.
Description for Internal Candidates

What you will be doing:

Be part of a small core team of senior individual contributors who are responsible for accelerating the delivery of high impact projects supporting critical trading workflows.
You will be working directly with stakeholders to understand the problems, and then formulate, socialize and deliver solutions.
Build dynamic modern UIs, microservices, Java architecture, leveraging private and/or public cloud.
Impact thousands of clients and accelerate delivery of a number of internal teams.
Work closely with the mutual fund team to drive cutting edge solutions

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Job_Description:
Project OpenCell

The OpenCell team is looking for a front end developer who is motivated to work on a big challenge, something that has never been done before . We are going to replace spreadsheets.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about coding. If you like working with the bleeding edge of open source technologies, if you like nothing better than to code for yourself on the weekends, then this is the best project at JPM for you.

There is no playbook for this project. This effort involves fundamental engineering challenges with no template on how to solve them. We need a motivated developer who is up for working with emerging libraries and ones that don't have fully documented code, such as regular-table, hyper-grid or arrow-js.



The OpenCell project is a rare opportunity for a developer to work on something completely new, using any technology we have to get the job done. Working on an existing application making incremental improvements to a system using asp.net will be easier and more predictable, but it won't be as interesting.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
Chase is the U.S. consumer and commercial banking business of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. Chase serves nearly half of America's households with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. Customers can choose how and where they want to bank: 5,300 branches, 16,000 ATMs, mobile, online and by phone. For more information, go to Chase.com.
JP Morgan Chase is committed to transforming the experience of our customers regardless of context. Our web and mobile banking products are used by millions of customers, and our numbers keep growing. Join the Digital Customer Experience team and help us design solutions that aspire to raise the quality of life of our customers (internal and external) each day. This role is an opportunity to elevate our internal tools to reflect one of our superpowers-finance.







Team Expectations



Required Experience



Knowledge And Skillset

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
J.P. Morgan is looking for an experienced, broad-minded Senior Product Design Manager to help us evolve our design practice, improve quality, and scale our team.

Design is core to the transformation of product development at J.P. Morgan, operating as a peer and partner with Product Owners, Engineering, and stakeholders within the business.

Crucial to this transformation will be Product Design Senior Managers, leading multiple, adjacent design teams in the evolution of our product experiences, ensuring that users remain at the heart of all decisions, and continually improving the quality of what we make.

Additionally, Managers look after the people in their team, through mentorship, professional development, and career-building. Managers are also the engine of recruiting and hiring, crucial as we continue to scale our organization.

This role is for those already with significant management experience. We're looking for a leader with a strong diplomatic bent, using their relationship skills to bring non-designers into the work, and uphold the values and quality standards in a stakeholder-rich environment.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
As a member of our Cybersecurity team, you'll help us launch a new platform with high visibility across the firm. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include designing, branding and building user interfaces which are intuitive, polished and beautiful, working alongside other designers as well as a cross-functional team of product managers, developers and business stakeholders.

As a User Experience Designer you'll be comfortable working from written requirements, user flows, wireframes and leveraging the company design system in Figma or Sketch to build final versions which will be passed to the development team.

You will have a keen eye and have a willingness to communicate what you see to others, coaching our growing development team to understand the nuances of your design including how it reacts in responsive ways to different browser sizes, understanding margins + padding, different states, colors, ensuring that your vision is properly implemented. At times, you'll also be asked to work in a UX capacity thinking through how your solutions ultimately affect the end user experience of the product.

The platform is brand new and has its own custom brand and styling. You'll have the freedom to further develop, create and refine this platform as it evolves.



Your day-to-day responsibilities include participating in standups with your pod to catch up on the sprint's objectives, while on the side you may be working closely with the design system lead or UX lead to ensure that the component library is functioning as it should. Once or twice a week, you'll also catch up with your fellow designers to share work and discuss areas of improvement that you are seeing across the platform. You are continually thinking of ways to make the platform look and feel sophisticated, intuitive and refined.





Our Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You'll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech organizations. In our global technology centers, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
This is an outstanding opportunity for a data-savvy, business-aware and detail-oriented digital designer. You will lead the delivery of design solutions on a market leading platform in a fast-paced, results-driven environment, where demand for the team's services and expertise is high.

As a product designer, you'll focus on client-facing applications and will be responsible for conceiving and delivering innovative design solutions to complex business and data problems in a collaborative and rewarding environment. Working as a valued member of a collaborative multidisciplinary team, you'll work in partnership with our visual designers, service designers, product managers, business stakeholders and development teams to shape the direction of our products.

In this role, you will:
Work on the external client facing digital channels for a breadth of businesses within the Securities Services division of JP Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
As a Senior User Experience Designer, you'll be building on your solid foundation in UX design, delivering designs to make sure projects meet business goals and deadlines. You will join our growing team in our New York studio, which will require a strong point of view on design, hands-on creation of experiences, developing strategies for implementation within a complex ecosystem and building meaningful and collaborative relationships within the team and broader organization.

Putting our customers and their needs first remains the top goal for our User Experience team. As a Senior User Experience Designer, you'll be responsible for design delivery work across 2 products as well as helping shape the vision of our products. Working as a valued member of a multidisciplinary design team, you'll be involved in complex projects, and will participate in user research and design planning to respond to feedback.

In addition to primary project work you'll hone your communication skills by presenting your work to diverse stakeholders and the broader technology organization. You will be working in a fast-paced environment alongside our data, product and engineering teams to deliver new experiences

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

To be considered for this position, you must have a portfolio available for review.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
We're looking for UX Design Director who will help set the direction, vision, and methodology across teams and set the bar for quality by example, with energy and passion. This will require a strong point of view on design, hands-on creation of experiences, developing strategies for implementation within a complex ecosystem and building meaningful relationships within the organization.

While undertaking an aggressive digital transformation agenda, which builds on the success of existing teams, this leadership role requires a deep understanding of experience design for consumer-facing digital products and services of all kinds, sizes, shapes and contexts.

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Building and leading a world class user experience design team to drive business results
Developing appropriate ongoing connection and buy in with the relevant cross functional stakeholders.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
Chase is looking for highly motivated Lead Product Designers to lead the efforts to create useful, usable, and desirable products for Chase Wealth Management. Design is core to the transformation of product development at Chase, operating as a peer and partner with Product Owners and Engineering. Financial management tools should demonstrate the same care and craft as consumer software, designed with contemporary user- and human-centered practices.

Success comes from understanding the customer and business needs, strong collaboration with your peers, thoughtful planning and coordination across scrum teams, taming complexity for our users, and overseeing full range of design practice, from up-front research, insights, and strategy, though to ideation, prototyping, and testing, and to delivery of final designs.

This role does not have direct reports, but leads small multi-disciplinary teams, including experience researchers and content designers.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
What you will be doing:
Design experiences across our Auto Servicing & Collections products
Review user research; identify opportunities for making improvements
Work with Product and Research to contribute to product requirements, including specifying desired outcomes
Ideation and prototyping to explore different options, including unexpected, but still workable solutions
Diagram the interactivity of the product ecosystem with user flows and wireframes
Detailed design, built upon our Design System, that brings our solutions to life
Advocate for Accessibility and Inclusive Design practices

Our Desired Profile

About Us

Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

About the Team

Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We're proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions - all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.

The Digital team is dedicated to creating innovative, industry-leading products and experiences that help customers access, share and control their financial data so they can make smart decisions with their money. Teams enable innovation while adhering to the firm's data sharing principles of security, customer control and convenience, and privacy.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
We are actively seeking an energetic and innovative Sr. UX Designer to join our group. Our team develops and refines the tools that are essential for helping our clients grow, maintain, and make their money work smarter so they can reach their financial goals. The products we design must add value and strengthen the relationship between our clients and their advisors while adding minimal complexity to their already busy lives. To do our job well, we utilize user-centered techniques to help us break through the industry jargon and bureaucracy and find insights that others can't.

About the Opportunity

As a Sr. UX Designer, you will leverage your deep understanding of experience design for digital products. You'll be at the forefront of our efforts and be directly responsible for decisions that form our client and advisor experiences. This is a hands-on designer role. You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team that includes researchers, content writers, product managers, engineers, and business partners who share your passion for delivering unique and innovative financial digital products and services of all kinds, including trading and advice platforms. In addition, this role works directly with an international team located in London, Glasgow, New York, Bangalore, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Geneva.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
J.P. Morgan Chase is looking for a deeply experienced, broad-minded Product Design Director to establish creative and strategic design leadership across internal tools. Design is core to the transformation of product development at JP Morgan Chase, operating as a peer and partner with Product Managers, Engineering, and leadership within the business. Financial management tools should demonstrate the same care and craft as consumer software, designed with contemporary user- and human-centered practices.
This transformation requires research and design influence and contributions at the highest organizational levels. Working alongside other Executive and Managing Directors, this role leads efforts that cross the entire line of business. A facilitative leadership style helps drive this shift with senior design, research, product, and engineering leaders to envision the evolution of internal tools.

The Product Design Director leads, facilitates, guides, and mentors team members to be more customer-centric, experimental, holistic, and to constantly challenge themselves to deliver outstanding new experiences.

Design Directors are expected strong partners with GMs, Senior Product Managers and Engineering Leads, co-developing product and business strategy, which informs prioritization, planning, and decisions across multiple product teams.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
We are looking for a profoundly engaged experience designer to join us. In this role, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team of designers, planners and researchers committed to designing the future of commerce in banking. This role requires a deep understanding of experience design for digital products and services of all kinds, sizes, shapes and contexts.
The Designer will influence and help drive the direction, vision, and methodology for a growing team in our New York studio and set the bar for quality by example, with energy and passion. This will require a strong point of view on design, hands-on creation of experiences, developing strategies for implementation within a complex ecosystem and building meaningful relationships within the organization.

A user-centric view is paramount while providing simple, fun and innovatively enriching web and mobile experiences for our customers. You will be working in a fast-paced environment alongside our data, product and engineering teams to deliver new experiences (from Customer Journeys & Ecosystem Maps to Participatory Design Prototypes & Wireframes).



A balanced understanding of strategy, research, interaction and visual design is a must. Finally, you are a customer experience advocate, excited about our customer's lives through simple, intelligent and enriching products and experiences.

InstaMed, a J.P. Morgan company, powers a better healthcare payments experience on one platform that connects consumers, providers, and payers for every healthcare payment transaction. InstaMed's patented, private cloud-based technology securely transforms healthcare payments by driving electronic transactions, processing payments and moving healthcare data seamlessly, and improving consumer satisfaction.

The User Experience Designer position will be responsible for contributing to multiple InstaMed products and solutions. The focus of this role is to work across different product teams to deliver a cohesive, competitive, high-quality product design to all customers. This position will be responsible for completing tasks such as heuristics/market analysis, outlining/wireframing, and designing prototypes in all stages of the product life cycle. We are searching for a candidate that has strong UX/UI design skills and a firm understanding of UX research methods.

Title: User Experience Design Director
Job_Description:
With geographic boundaries vanishing and new forms of fast-moving digital currency gaining momentum, it's an exciting time for you to join Chase's Consumer Payments UX team. Our band of UXers love design and we're endlessly fascinated by the inner workings of paying for stuff-that seemingly mundane task all of us humans on Earth do on a nearly daily basis.

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our Consumer Payments team, which creates experiences that impacts millions of people & small businesses who send & request money every single day. Authenticity, inclusion, growth, and a passion for designing delightful payments experiences are part of our core values. If you're nodding your head right now, you need to apply because you've found your posse.

As our next Senior Product Designer, you'll create experiences that impact millions of people and small businesses who send and request money every day.



You've got a knack for solving knotty problems through crude prototypes, the poise and grit to socialize your solutions with top product partners, a passion for the consumer payments space, and the desire to see through our customers' eyes. These traits will define your success as a Senior UX Designer, and we can't wait to welcome you to the team if you:

Thrive in collaborative, team-oriented, cross-functional environments

Have a passion for creating simple, beautiful solutions to complex problems.

Are skillful at applying different design tools in creating user flows, storyboards, and prototypes to explore concepts and tell the story behind the design

Have a growth mindset, value inclusion, and be able to bring your real self to work.

Have designed for both mobile and web

Receptive to feedback and able to rapidly iterate, concept, and prototype solutions

Can take designs from early concept to detailed delivery















About Us

Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

At Chase, we're proud to serve nearly half of America's households with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. One of DXD's most important contributions to J.P. Morgan is the UI Toolkit-the solution for building multichannel user interfaces at scale that incorporate best-of-breed interactions and visual design. Title: Mobile Software Engineering Lead- Enterprise Workplace
Job_Description:
Application Security

Leveraging your development and security background, you will produce a library of consistent, secure, automated patterns for Java, Python, React and Angular in Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Cloud Foundry, and Kubernetes environments. These patterns include both documentation explaining the requirements and rationale for the design, and directly usable code samples, development frameworks, and automated deployment scripts. A typical journey will involve documenting and getting agreement to the approach & value suggested, researching the key compliance and security requirements, and then designing & prototyping application libraries, frameworks, APIs and platform automation services for industrialization with the engineering teams.

You will bring your desire to press into a variety of different technologies and development teams to work across a set of the potential adopters and rapidly break new ground, improving existing control approaches with the engineers adopting the pattern you help design, while keeping an eye on developing standards for APIs, deployment orchestration, data models and security standards to continuously improve consistency and convenience for our developers.

This role is all about taking identified problem areas and moving quickly to proven solution approaches that can be ported across different technologies and tested against changing requirements over time.







The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm's cybersecurity, access management, controls and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group's number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable and resilient.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $10B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

The JPMorgan Wealth Management (JPMWM) business is focused on helping investors achieve their long-term financial goals and is comprised of the Chase wealth management business, J.P. Morgan Securities and Online Investments - our digital investing platform. The combined business has ~$400 billion in assets under management and ~4,000 advisors who work out of 3,500 branches and 21 offices.

The Trading & Investments team (T&I) is developing industry leading online brokerage products, tools, and content/insights for investors. The platforms we build are flexible and resilient, they are used by millions of clients through web and mobile channels. These technology solutions enable our clients to trade, monitor and discover new investments to help them make the most of their money, build their wealth and reach their life goals.

Title: Mobile Software Engineering Lead- Enterprise Workplace
Job_Description:
Chase is seeking a talented product analyst to join our product development efforts and drive excellence in our Conversational AI team within the Consumer & Community Bank's Digital Products Organization. The Chase Digital Assistance (CDA) product area manages the Digital Assistant, Natural Language Search (NLS) and Elastic Search (ES) teams to create engaging and sophisticated natural language experiences to enable convenient, friction-less, consumer financial services experiences which is currently in the mobile app (Digital Assistant), search functions on chase.com and across platforms and channels.

Job Summary

This role will be key in continuously improving the Customer Conversations by Chase Conversational AI. Collaboration with product owners both within and outside of the team, designers, software developers and testers will be required to develop a unified customer experience to support all varieties of consumer product sets.

This position requires the ability to come up to speed quickly on the business functionality of an array of inter-connected software components in order to deliver an optimized customer conversation. Experience working with Natural Language Platforms and Conversational AI is required this position. Candidates should have motivation and drive to lead initiatives through completion, ensuring all aspects of the experience are delivered with a high degree of quality and across an efficient timeline. Excellent written and oral communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, and outstanding analytical and research skills, as well as a passion for digital and emerging technologies are also qualities that would make for an effective candidate.

Title: Mobile Software Engineering Lead- Enterprise Workplace
Job_Description:
Our teams are in Silicon Valley and Plano. We build modern responsive web applications and services tailored to meet the needs of our Commercial Clients.

A Lead Software Engineer in Digital Commercial Bank will work across a range of products and technologies. They will have two primary focuses: First, they will be building customer facing User Experiences using various JavaScript Single Page App technologies like React and Angular. Second, they will work across the tech stack by building micro services and storing/sharing data via technologies like Cassandra and Kafka.

A Lead Software Engineer should have significant hands-on experience building enterprise level web applications across UI, services, and database. They should have demonstrated leadership skills on enterprise software projects. They should work at an expert level in building modern single page UI applications using OO JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. They should be experienced in working with API Gateways that adhere to data governance. They should have enterprise experience designing and implementing REST APIs. They should have knowledge designing and querying both relational and NoSQL databases. They would ultimately be responsible for troubleshooting and debugging applications at all layers and take end to end application ownership.

Title: VP- CDO Account Data Product Owner/Project manager
Job_Description:
Overview

A critical priority for our Firm is to ensure that high-quality data is available to run our business and meet our clients' needs. The Asset & Wealth Management (AWM) Chief Data Office (CDO) defines AWM's data strategy and support for the core data used across AWM and needed to run our business, such as client data, reference data, product data, securities and pricing data, transactions and holdings, and index data. The AWM CDO is positioned in the Asset & Wealth Management Operations division, within AWM Center. We work with the AWM business and Firm wide CDO to analyze data, ensure data governance and data quality standards are in place, look for efficiencies in business processes, and work with our technology partners to implement solutions.
The Wealth Management Product Owner (PO) will be primarily focused on the Party and Account (P&A) Data Domain. The PO will collaborate with other project/program managers, business and data analysts, business SMEs, and technology teams to drive data strategy, ensuring clear priorities and completion of tasks, mitigating risks and overall leading the project to deliver on business benefits.

Chase Consumer & Community Banking serves nearly 66 million consumers and 4 million small businesses with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, small business banking and lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice.

This role will be part of CCB's Holistic Lifecycle Management (HLM) team and be aligned to one of the firm's many Control Domain Authorities (CDA's). Job_Description:
Join CCB's newest Service - Platform Operations . Our team fosters a model for CCB technology, product, design, & data teams to work with organizations outside CCB. Our structure compliments the GT Product Operating model - ensuring bi-directional alignment of interests between the GT and CCB products. To ensure CCB is represented on GT Product Cabinets, Platform Operations facilitates communities of expertise to garner insight and opinion from across our entire LoB to shape GT Product roadmaps. Conversely, Platform Operations, through the Clearinghouse, examines requests for work and facilitates their injection into our CCB product backlogs. To amplify success our team provides visibility into status of execution for all requests - both by and on-behalf of CCB products.

This Program Manager will oversee the creation, implementation, governance, and continuously improvement of how the CCB Platform Operations Service functions. Proactively partner the CCB Product Office, GT Product Office, CCB product teams, other LoB Clearinghouses to ensure solutions work in concert - sharing best practices. Position will help drive ONE Backlog initiative which has the goal of getting all the work engineers deliver captured on their backlogs .

The Firmwide Regulatory Reporting & Analysis (FRRA) team resides within Corporate Finance. The group is responsible for the execution and delivery against the Firm's regulatory reporting requirements to its U.S. regulators. The team has end-to-end responsibility for US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing, including the design, implementation, and oversight of the execution, analysis, control and governance frameworks. Its mandate includes determining the appropriate investment in people, processes and technology to improve the accuracy, completeness and consistency of the Firm's US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing submissions, as well as the implementation of new requirements and guidelines as they are published.

The objectives of the FRRA Team are to provide leadership on all aspects of US regulatory reporting and Firm wide capital stress-testing, including both internal and regulatory requirements



The FRRA Technology & Innovation Strategy team is responsible for the delivery of applications and tools that enable data management, controls, data modelling, data aggregation, analytics, and reporting. The Project Management Vice President's primary responsibility will be working on the build out and modernization of applications and services utilized for external reporting that align to critical firm-wide initiatives in a product owner/scrum master capacity. The Vice President will partner with users, architecture and technology teams delivering within an agile framework responsible for managing the prioritized backlog to ensure the team is always maximizing delivery value against the firm's & FRRA goals.

Job_Description:
This is a role on the Organizational Operations team which is a part of Corporate Technology's CCB Risk organization. This role will support one of the CTO's direct reports and his/her organization (100+ people). This role will handle all organizational operation functions for the supported tower, such as headcount management, budgeting, requisition management, software invoices, contractor vendor management, transfers of budget for headcount, infrastructure, applications, etc.

As a member of our Project Execution team, you'll draw on your strengths managing people and processes to manage technology projects that typically span multiple lines of business and have firm-wide implications. You'll lead these projects from initiation through implementation, including: establishing project requirements, priorities and deadlines; ensuring that relevant risk and architecture requirements are in place; and managing the project budget and resources. In addition to collaborating with your teammates, you'll communicate with stakeholders across the firm to work toward the best possible outcomes. While this role is rooted in project management, it's a terrific opportunity to develop your leadership skills and make lasting connections throughout JPMorgan Chase & Co.

This role requires a wide range of strengths and capabilities, including:

Experience project managing multiple projects
Very strong communication skills and confidence to speak to Managing Directors, Executive Directors, and comfortable speaking to large audiences on conference calls
Knowledge of global and line of business project management standards and methods
Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals
Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals on the Organizational Operations team, as well as the supported organization, and throughout the firm
Resourcefulness to overcome obstacles independently
Proficiency in one or more business disciplines or functions
Expert level skills in Excel and the ability to manipulate large data sets for organizational analysis is desired
Detail-oriented skills to catch and fix anomalies in the data
Advanced PowerPoint skills and a knack for visual representation of data to communicate key messages
Ability to see the top down view while simultaneously understanding individual level details in order to help improve overall organizational operations efficiency
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience

Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

Title: VP- CDO Account Data Product Owner/Project manager
Job_Description:
About This Position

The Lending Innovation team is dedicated to meeting the borrowing and financing needs of our customers through alternative lending solutions. We are seeking a highly effective and innovative Vice President to support the development, launch, and growth of a new consumer lending product and roadmap.

The ideal candidate is highly organized, self-motivated, and experienced in project management and agile product delivery with a history of supporting successful product launches. The candidate must have strong collaboration skills with Product, Design, Engineering, General Management, other first and second line cross functional partners, and the flexibility to adapt to internal and competitive market forces.

This position sits within the Connected Commerce organization, a key business within Chase Consumer & Community Banking.



This person will be responsible for collaborating with stakeholders on vision and strategic pillars required to deliver new products. They will coordinate and sequence product delivery with cross impacted teams (product, technology and operations, etc) and execute critical path deliverables during product life cycle (i.e., discovery, initiation, development, testing).

This person will actively manage engagement metrics (i.e. utilization of sprints against planned sprint cycles) and understand and communicate prioritization of features, with a mind toward user and business benefits and tradeoffs. They will also coordinate project deliverables required for release readiness (NFRs, implementation plan, release management, sign offs, etc) and act as an escalation point for all project resources to support delivery.

Lastly, they will act as a strategic partner to product managers and lean into ownership of certain product features, communicate on behalf of the project and have confidence representing the voice of the product.

Title: VP- CDO Account Data Product Owner/Project manager
Job_Description:
Global Security (GS) protects the firm's employees and assets throughout the world. This responsibility includes the development of security and safety policies and procedures, regulatory and legislative compliance, corporate aviation, guard management, alarm response, crisis management, ATM, branch and corporate building security and customer safety, physical crime investigations, workplace violence, fire and life safety, pre-employment screening, fraud and employee investigations.

Within GS, the Insider Threat, Counterintelligence and Workplace Violence team is responsible for identifying potential threats against the firm and its workforce from internal and external actors and developing strategies to mitigate those threats to protect the firm's reputation, workforce, clients, and assets. This is an entry to intermediate level Associate Analyst position primarily responsible for the review and analysis of the insider events and incidents (including rotational on call responsibilities) and development and delivery of cutting-edge enterprise-wide solutions to detect, analyze, and mitigate risks and threats to the firm from insiders. The candidate must be a highly motivated individual with strong interpersonal skills able to leverage their insider threat and counterintelligence experience to work on multiple assignments in accordance with dynamic priorities in a fast-paced environment. The position will work closely with various partners within the firm including but not limited to HR, Legal, Cybersecurity, and Technology, as well as external partners. The ability to work effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders is essential. The role requires creativity, critical thinking, strong communication skills, and the ability to work effectively across a large international organization that comprises an important part of the financial sector and U.S. critical infrastructure.

About Figg

Figg is a leading transaction-based digital advertising platform company with a mission to uncover value in everyday transactions. Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
As a member of the Cyber security organization, you'll play a crucial role in identifying, improving, and developing technology solutions that drive our strategic goals. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about high-priority initiatives and partner continuously with cyber operations, product and technology teams. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management, and communication skills. You'll make a meaningful impact and lasting connections with outstanding colleagues, leadership and mentors. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of the creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.

The Cyber security organization's objective is to ensure that JPMC is able to effectively detect, prevent, and respond to cyber threats against our technology infrastructure. The scope of Cyber security comprises detection and monitoring of threats and vulnerabilities, managing security incidents, and evolving our preventive infrastructure to keep ahead of the threat. We accomplish this through strong information security leadership and active collaboration with line of business information risk managers to provide high quality security solutions and services that are focused on improving the Firm's risk posture.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Overview

A critical priority for our Firm is to ensure that high-quality data is available to run our business and meet our clients' needs. The Asset & Wealth Management (AWM) Chief Data Office (CDO) defines AWM's data strategy and support for the core data used across AWM and needed to run our business, such as client data, reference data, product data, securities and pricing data, transactions and holdings, and index data. The AWM CDO is positioned in the Asset & Wealth Management Operations division, within AWM Center. We work with the AWM business and Firm wide CDO to analyze data, ensure data governance and data quality standards are in place, look for efficiencies in business processes, and work with our technology partners to implement solutions.
The Wealth Management Product Owner (PO) will be primarily focused on the Party and Account (P&A) Data Domain. The PO will collaborate with other project/program managers, business and data analysts, business SMEs, and technology teams to drive data strategy, ensuring clear priorities and completion of tasks, mitigating risks and overall leading the project to deliver on business benefits.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Global Security (GS) protects the firm's employees and assets throughout the world. This responsibility includes the development of security and safety policies and procedures, regulatory and legislative compliance, corporate aviation, guard management, alarm response, crisis management, ATM, branch and corporate building security and customer safety, physical crime investigations, workplace violence, fire and life safety, pre-employment screening, fraud and employee investigations.

Within GS, the Insider Threat, Counterintelligence and Workplace Violence team is responsible for identifying potential threats against the firm and its workforce from internal and external actors and developing strategies to mitigate those threats to protect the firm's reputation, workforce, clients, and assets. This is an entry to intermediate level Associate Analyst position primarily responsible for the review and analysis of the insider events and incidents (including rotational on call responsibilities) and development and delivery of cutting-edge enterprise-wide solutions to detect, analyze, and mitigate risks and threats to the firm from insiders. The candidate must be a highly motivated individual with strong interpersonal skills able to leverage their insider threat and counterintelligence experience to work on multiple assignments in accordance with dynamic priorities in a fast-paced environment. The position will work closely with various partners within the firm including but not limited to HR, Legal, Cybersecurity, and Technology, as well as external partners. The ability to work effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders is essential. The role requires creativity, critical thinking, strong communication skills, and the ability to work effectively across a large international organization that comprises an important part of the financial sector and U.S. critical infrastructure.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
As a member of our Infrastructure Development team, you'll dive right into creating innovative solutions that advance businesses and careers. You'll join an inspiring and curious team of technologists dedicated to developing and deploying large-scale infrastructure solutions that support JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s diverse and critical businesses. You'll be using the latest technologies, data management, and security practices in all aspect of software development. Critical thinking, clear communication, and collaboration are key to successful product delivery.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
Software development experience in Python.
Experience working with two or more from the following: web application development, database, unix/linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, information retrieval, networking, large scale software development, security software development



You will join Technology Reference Data (TRD) team focused on transformation of data quality management within GTI (Global Technology Infrastructure) and contributing to the strategy and execution of IDaaP (Infrastructure Data as a product) initiatives.

You will get fantastic opportunity on creating innovative solutions that transform Data as a Service. You'll join an inspiring and curious team of technologists dedicated to improving the design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming that goes into creating high quality products.

Location: Jacksonville, Florida  Preferred. Remote US will be considered.
Azimuth GRC is revolutionizing the world of regulatory compliance with automated compliance management technology. Our innovative solution helps companies comply with federal and state laws and ensures that every customer receives fair and equitable experiences.
We are seeking stand-out individuals to join our well-funded, growing startup. Qualified candidates must possess an insatiable desire to innovate, execute and follow-through. The right candidates detest manual processes, outdated spreadsheets, mediocrity and moving at a glacial pace.
If you are interested in joining a team that is transforming the culture of compliance and driving equity, Azimuth GRC is for you. We proudly reward employees with equity compensation when the company succeeds.

Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you'll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You'll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you-and the products you deliver-will thrive.

Launch your career in Technology Operations and put your creative problem solving into action, delivering solutions that shape the future of global business. Finally, your strong technology background will ensure that the security and standards of our commitment to excellence are met. And because professional development is a key component of our culture, you'll receive coaching, mentoring - and a host of other development opportunities - alongside your invaluable on-the-job experience.

As a Data Center Operations Engineer I, your mission is to support the day-to-day technology operations of JPMorgan Chase mission critical data centers. The purpose of this role is to maintain operational stability and handle customer requests while working on shifts to support the 24x7 operation. You will be responsible for installing and configuring enterprise class technology hardware, troubleshooting hardware and network issues, maintain change control process in the data center, and support 3rd party vendor activities. This position is full-time, working with team members on a rotating shift providing coverage during daytime, overnight, weekend and holiday hours.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Description: Public Finance Trading Analyst

Analysts within trading teams work with top professionals to help support trading with a variety of institutional clients comprised of banks, fund managers, insurance companies, managed accounts, and hedge funds. You will learn how infrastructure capital flows from the largest institutional investors and individuals to the municipal institutions which build the nation's infrastructure. You will receive training, direct learning opportunities, continuous mentoring and feedback, as well as numerous development opportunities to enable you to advance your career.

Public Finance Trading: As an Analyst in Public Finance trading, you will provide support to traders covering institutional accounts and making markets in municipal bonds and other non-profit securities. You will assist the traders in managing risk, liquidity and exposure and support all aspects of the trading desk: pre-trade analysis, credit & high yield research, inbound and outbound trade processing and advanced data analytics, including algo pricing applications. Tracking supply and demand, you constantly evaluate market developments and dynamics in order to give clients and traders the best information available.

The team is responsible for identifying, capturing and validating corporate action announcement information throughout the lifecycle of the corporate action and partnering with various lines of business that subscribe to and utilize the information . You will be responsible for creating corporate action announcement notifications on all voluntary events on behalf of a global customer base utilizing multifunctional proprietary and vendor systems. The WHEM AC team is responsible for sourcing and publishing events in the US, Canadian and Latin American markets.

Key Responsibilities:
Candidate will be responsible for sourcing, validating and publishing corporate action notifications for the US, Canadian and Latin American markets.
Candidate will focus on voluntary and choice events but, require an understanding of mandatory and income events as well

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
As a member of the Attack Analysis team within the JPMorgan Chase & Co. SOC, you will fit into a global team providing 24/7 monitoring and Incident Response, acting as the frontline for attacks against the firms' infrastructure. As a shift analyst, your role will include monitoring alerts triggered from in-house bespoke signatures in a SIEM, start to finish case investigation, threat hunting, file analysis, as well as getting involved in projects that aim to improve the capability of the team. You'll have opportunities to attend training and conferences that benefit the skillset of the team and your own. You'll be encouraged to conduct your own hunting investigations and create rule logic to fill the gaps in monitoring that you identify or alert on upcoming threats you think may be targeted at the firm. The work you'll do is vital, as it will protect over $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits every day.

Corporate and Investment Bank Operations Analyst

J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services.

The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. More than 48,000 employees operate worldwide for the firm.

With $20.5 trillion of assets under custody, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.
Role Description.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
The Corporate Client Banking & Specialized Industries group is part of Commercial Banking at JPMorgan Chase and focuses on companies typically with revenues of over $500mm which require traditional banking services in addition to investment banking products. Our competitive advantage is that we cover this market in a truly unique way - through a partnership between our corporate bankers and investment bankers who together build relationships with our clients and offer customized financial solutions. Our investment bankers bring strategic ideas to clients, which are executed with investment banking products. Our corporate bankers provide commercial banking products and structure loan facilities for our clients. This approach brings together integrated financial services ranging from cash management to raising capital and partners closely with Investment Banking, Corporate Derivatives Marketing, Treasury Services and Asset and Wealth Management, among others.

Each CB registered banker is required to hold the FINRA Series 79 (Limited Representative - Investment Banking) and Series 63 (Uniform Securities Agent State Law Exam) Licenses, or the ability to obtain within a reasonable amount of time following start date. In addition to the Series 79 and Series 63, the Securities Industry Essentials (SIE) exam is a general knowledge exam and co-requisite to representative level exams required for newly registered employees or for those whose registration has lapsed.

The final level of the position will be determined at the time of an offer.



As a Corporate Client Banking & Specialized Industries Analyst, you will:



If you have not already done so, you will participate in our Investment Banking training program, giving you key technical and practical knowledge. You'll also attend an additional Credit and Treasury Services training program in Chicago to round out your skills. This combination of training is unique to our program and will provide you with a foundation advise complex clients across our full product suite.

You will also have the opportunity to hear from and network with senior leaders and spend time with peers from programs across the bank at philanthropic and group events.



We are looking for individuals with the intellectual curiosity and drive to contribute to the development and execution of comprehensive banking solutions for our clients. You'll also have:

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
About J.P. Morgan

J.P. Morgan is a leader in financial services, offering innovative and intelligent solutions to clients in more than 100 countries with one of the most comprehensive global product platforms available. We have been helping our clients to do business and manage their wealth for more than 200 years and we keep their interests foremost in our minds at all times. This combination of product strength, intellectual capital and character sets us apart as an industry leader. Information about J.P. Morgan is available at www.jpmorganchase.com .

Securities Services

Securities Services, a division of J.P. Morgan Chase Bank, N.A.'s Corporate & Investment Bank, is a global industry leader with 26 trillion in assets under Securities Services. J.P. Morgan provides innovative securities services, fund accounting and administration and securities services to the world's largest institutional investors, alternative asset managers and debt and equity issuers. J.P. Morgan's Securities Services business is comprised of Securities Services, Accounting, Transfer Agency, Middle Office outsourcing, Foreign Exchange, and other activities related to servicing assets for traditional and alternative funds; it leverages its scale and capabilities in more than 100 markets to help clients optimize efficiency, mitigate risk and enhance revenue through a broad range of securities services as well as securities clearance, collateral management and alternative investment services investments around the world.



The Americas Securities Services Liquidity Solutions Associate will support in the management of the deposit and investment product family, providing and developing innovative solutions to defend and grow the Securities Services deposit program. Products under management include Earnings Credit Rate, Interest-Bearing Deposits and Overdrafts. These products vary in their degree of complexity, some of which are inherently complex due to considerations around regulations, tax and balance sheet dynamics, and sophisticated delivery model. The incumbent will need to gain an understanding of prevalent regulations, as well as grasp rapidly evolving ones, such as, those under Basel III regime. The role will support the America's lead for Solutions in articulating the product strategy and vision to a wide cross-section of constituents in the Bank, across functions and geographies; secure senior sponsorship and guide execution teams/programs towards realizing the vision into design, delivery and commercial readiness.







Our team is located in NYC 3 days a week with 2 days remote. This is not a fully remote position.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
The Treasury and Chief Investment Office (TCIO) at JPMorgan Chase & Co. is responsible for firm wide asset and liability management for one of the world's largest global financial institutions with more than $3.9tn in assets and liabilities, including more than $2.6tn in deposits.

TCIO is responsible for developing and executing the firm's capital, balance sheet, liquidity and funding strategy. TCIO oversees a ~$665 billion global investment securities portfolio used to manage the firm's interest rate and currency exposure.

CIO Mortgage Servicing Right (MSR) Hedging Team:

The CIO Mortgage Servicing Right (MSR) hedging team within TCIO is looking for an analyst in its New York City office. The team is responsible for the dynamic hedging of a significant marked to market asset of the firm, Mortgage Servicing Rights (MSR). The team manages the market risk factors of the $8 billion Chase's Mortgage Servicing Rights, through the use of linear (Treasury, interest rate swaps, futures), non-linear (interest rate options, board options) rates related products, as well as mortgage products. We work closely with Chase Mortgage Bank to understand MSR asset's sensitivity to assumption inputs and formulate/execute efficient hedging strategies regarding longer term trends.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Our business

Treasury/CIO oversees a $600Bn global fixed income investment portfolio used to manage the Firm's interest rate and currency exposure. The portfolio comprises a wide range of fixed income products, including asset-and-mortgage backed securities, municipal bonds, and government securities. The Treasury/CIO team manages the risk emanating from this investment portfolio as well as "other" Corporate businesses (Firm-wide Pension Plan, Insurance programs, and Mortgage Servicing Rights).

Our team

The Credit QR team is responsible for developing and maintaining models for valuation, risk, PL calculations, as well as quoting and market making algorithms and analysis tools for the Global Spread business. The responsibilities of the team span the full range from new model specification, going through model approval, ensuring compliance with internal policies and industry regulations, implementation of model in library, to integration into risk and PL systems.



The opportunity is to join our New York Credit QR team, with a focus on Treasury and Chief Investment Office coverage. This involves adapting and creating pricing models and infrastructure for municipal bonds and corporate bonds. The role is spanning all aspects of QR coverage, from the mathematical modelling to the development of model evaluation platforms in our risk system.










The role requires the combination of very strong software development skills, a very structured mathematical approach to problem solving, business overview, and the ability to work in a dynamic environment. Prior knowledge of quantitative modeling and risk neutral pricing is a plus, but not an absolute requirement. Excellent oral communication skills are required in our interaction with trading, technology, and control functions. Excellent written communication skills are also required for meeting the high standards of the model documentation. A strong interest in good software design principles is a requirement as well. A Ph.D. in a numerate subject from a top academic institution is a plus, but not an absolute requirement.














J.P. Morgan's Global Quants Group provides a challenging work environment and excellent opportunities to learn and grow both at the Quants Group and in the Firm's global network.

Helps build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining software and systems to develop creative engineering solutions to operations problems. Much of our support and software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure, and reducing work through automation.

Manage individual workload and work of the team, identify/mitigate risks to delivering solution on time within the best practices of Agile/Scrum/LeSS; Define entry criteria for Data Delivery VDE environment and may be responsible for one or more teams and will oversee activities of junior Engineering team members as applicable and provide individuals with constructive feedback as it pertains to team performance; Coach staff in technical matters and delivering on other job-related responsibilities.
