Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
At J.P. Morgan Advisors, a division of J.P. Morgan Wealth Management, we have been helping high net worth individuals and families build and manage their wealth for more than 50 years. Comprised of an exclusive group of Wealth Advisors throughout the United States, J.P. Morgan Advisors offers clients a broad suite of transactional, wealth management and investment advisory services. Our Wealth Advisors are among the most experienced and knowledgeable in the industry. We excel at leveraging the vast resources of one of the world's leading global financial institutions on behalf of our clients.

The J.P. Morgan Advisors Summer Analyst Program is a 9-week introduction to our Full-Time Program. Summer Analysts are paired with Wealth Advisors & their teams to experience how they deliver highly customized and comprehensive solutions to help protect, manage, and grow wealth for clients. Summer Analysts will gain exposure to every facet of wealth management, including investments, lending, banking, as well as trust and estate planning. No client has identical goals, so understanding their unique needs and tailoring the approach to exceed expectations requires work across teams and the firm to provide the best possible client experience and service. Opportunities are available in a variety of U.S. locations.

Chase has more than 65MM digitally active customers frequently using our digital banking and card products and services. A critical part of Chase customers' loyalty and engagement lies in the market-leading set of benefits and rewards available on Travel, Dining, and experiences. We are building a new generation of Shopping tools that will help Chase customers access hundreds of brands and thousands of top-quality products that can be purchased directly from Chase and can be combined with other value-generating solutions available, such as points, payment options, promotions, and product bundles.

In order to be successful with Shopping at Chase, we need to build consistent, integrated, and intuitive applications in both web and mobile environments. The Mobile Application team is providing a framework for a modern benefits and shopping platform based on the recent advances in Internet technologies.

As a lead Android/iOS engineer, you will be responsible for developing concepts, patterns, APIs and support technical roadmaps for the JPMorgan Chase mobile Shopping apps. You will also be required to document and illustrate framework capabilities, APIs, developer guides, and authoritatively support them through implementation and deployment phases, adjusting the approaches as challenges arise.

You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
7 + years of experience in application development and support environment with more than one technology and multiple design techniques

Our Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You'll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $10B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you

Responding to the evolving regulatory environment and helping to meet the firm's regulatory commitments by addressing internal and external commitments
Advancing the firm's Roadmap programs - Single Sourcing of data, Architecture Convergence, and Rationalization of Platforms

Title: Data Center Operations Engineer I
Job_Description:
DESCRIPTION:
Duties: Perform installations, upgrades, apply security patches, daily maintenance activities and provide technical support for the issues on infrastructure that is being used. Investigate new versions of applications, test the new functionalities along with Integration, Interactive, Load, stress & unit testing, document the results of upgrading to new version, communicate with clients, customers, and stakeholders, and prepare for upgrading the platforms to newer versions. Get the new version of client software from vendor, perform customizations as per the user, client, and customer requirement, test the functionalities and automate the software installation of the BI client products to users across the firm. Design the BI Infrastructure build automation which includes, Infrastructure build via IAC Terraform, pave & repave, recovery from last known active state and provide a highly functional & resilient BI infrastructure to clients, customers, and stakeholders. Perform testing and Identify gaps in risk & Controls, governance, encryption protocols & authentication mechanisms used by the applications and make sure they are secure end-to-end. Conduct periodic infrastructure review meetings, gather the user feedback, improve the performance of the applications as needed as usage increases.

Title: Data Center Operations Engineer I
Job_Description:
Cyber Security & Technology Controls (CTC) purpose is to ensure the security and resiliency of the firm's computing environment, protect customer and employee confidential information, and comply with regulatory requirements globally. We accomplish this through strong information security leadership and active collaboration with line of business information risk managers to provide high quality security solutions and services that are focused on improving the firm's risk posture. The Cyber Range team is composed of firm-wide functions (Cyber Range Training Platform (CRTP), Cyber Red Team (CRT), Attack Analyses (AA), Operational Assessment Pentest, Vulnerability Management Operations and Cyber Range Engineering teams) as well as business-aligned risk & resiliency management teams that affect the technology risk program across JPMC.

The successful candidate will be a strong technologist who is flexible, resilient, an innovative thinker, as well as a natural collaborator with enterprise architects, engineers, developers, and senior management from across the organization. Systems Engineering Team Lead is expected to lead and promote future proof cost effective architecture enabling resiliency/agility within our global technology products. In addition, the candidate must possess strong technical leadership skills, the ability to influence at all levels of the organization, demonstrated success in working with teams particularly with peer technology stakeholders/customers/clients, and communicate effectively through clarity of thought and demonstrate understanding of business and technical requirements.



About Us

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

About the Team

The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm's cybersecurity, access management, controls, and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group's number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable, and resilient.

High Risk Roles (HRR) are sensitive roles within the technology organization that require high assurance of the integrity of staff by virtue of 1) sensitive cybersecurity and technology functions they perform within systems or 2) information they receive regarding sensitive cybersecurity or technology matters. Users in these roles are subject to enhanced pre-hire screening which includes both criminal and credit background checks (as allowed by law). The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.

About AI Research

The goal of J.P. Morgan AI Research is to explore and advance cutting-edge research in AI, including ML as well as related fields like Cryptography, to develop and discover principles of impact to J.P. Job_Description:
Chase is seeking a talented product analyst to join our product development efforts and drive excellence in our Conversational AI team within the Consumer & Community Bank's Digital Products Organization. The Chase Digital Assistance (CDA) product area manages the Digital Assistant, Natural Language Search (NLS) and Elastic Search (ES) teams to create engaging and sophisticated natural language experiences to enable convenient, friction-less, consumer financial services experiences which is currently in the mobile app (Digital Assistant), search functions on chase.com and across platforms and channels.

Job Summary

This role will be key in continuously improving the Customer Conversations by Chase Conversational AI. Collaboration with product owners both within and outside of the team, designers, software developers and testers will be required to develop a unified customer experience to support all varieties of consumer product sets.

This position requires the ability to come up to speed quickly on the business functionality of an array of inter-connected software components in order to deliver an optimized customer conversation. Experience working with Natural Language Platforms and Conversational AI is required this position. Candidates should have motivation and drive to lead initiatives through completion, ensuring all aspects of the experience are delivered with a high degree of quality and across an efficient timeline. Excellent written and oral communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, and outstanding analytical and research skills, as well as a passion for digital and emerging technologies are also qualities that would make for an effective candidate.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
JPMorgan Chase is the largest bank in North America and among the largest banks in the world. At JPMC, the Enterprise Workplace Products (EWP) team is responsible for software, products and tools used by our more than 250,000 employees. EWP is delivering technology experiences that transform the way employees work, as well as enable the digital transformation of the bank .

Our employees are our greatest strength, and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion.

Enterprise Workplace Products (EWP) is responsible for engineering, developing, and supporting modern enterprise-wide solutions. These solutions deliver untethered access to a full range of digital capabilities that are reliable, secure and flexible. Our products and platforms include Workspace, Mobile, Collaboration, Communication, Digital Help, and Request capabilities.

Aligned to our multi-year strategy, both product and engineering teams drive the innovation that will continue to fundamentally transform the way we work. We are pushing product boundaries in cloud computing, AI/ML, serverless computing, mobile, and big data technologies to achieve our goals and deliver products that delight our customers.

We seek developers and engineers who are passionate about solving production problems through teamwork and innovation, while leveraging development and engineering best practices. In this role you will be part of an engineering team orchestrating a 300K+ mailbox hybrid Exchange platform. The role requires a messaging SME to focus on activities related to mergers & acquisitions as well as delivering automation for repetitive tasks.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.

As full-stack software engineer you will develop a product that processes roughly 50M messages through Flink a day from our bots, and then stores the messages in a Cassandra/JanusGraph big data store. From there we build models using Python/OmniAI and then serve up insights via java micro-services or use them for anomaly detection in our Flink jobs. We also have a UI that uses an internal Micro-UI framework. We have plans to be 95% in the cloud by 2021. This is a full-stack developer position, and you will be expected to develop 70% and support/improve your own components when they break 30%. We have no ops team - our litmus test is that we should be able to go on vacation for 6 months - and our bots and services should autonomously continue to operate and also keep themselves up to date.



Proficiency in Java 8 and AngularJS (or some other Javascript UI framework)
Resourceful, persistent, and motivated with a passion for quality programming and testing
Eager to learn, design, and collaborate to create runnable, testable features
Customer-first: always developing features with the customer in mind
Proactive problem solver and investigator
End to end, T-shaped developer: willing to talk to customers, gather requirements, refine your own backlog, develop amazing features, and deliver them to customers
Experience building/maintaining APIs and Micro Services leveraging Spring framework, Spring Boot, Gaia/Cloud Foundry
Experience working on a full stack application
Keen interest in autonomous automation - where bots simulate human interactions with machine intelligence

J.P. Morgan Payments is among the world's largest, most trusted and innovative full-service providers in one of the most dynamic and rapidly transforming spaces in financial services. In addition to providing international cash management, liquidity, commercial card, FX, escrow solutions, merchant services and trade finance, we continue to invest in future-growth initiatives, such as blockchain, AI & ML, as well as form partnerships with rising fintechs to expand our client base and product offerings.

Boasting more than 135,000 clients in over 180 countries, J.P. Morgan Payments offers specialized solutions that provide operating efficiencies and value beyond other standardized solutions available in the market. Our global product and technology platform, integrated client service model and network of operational centers enable J.P. Morgan Payments to deliver a consistent set of services to clients no matter where they are across the world

As a Product Design Lead, you will leverage your deep understanding of research and experience design for digital products to generate innovative solutions that solve customer problems. You'll be at the forefront of strategic design efforts and you will be directly responsible for decisions that form client experiences at scale. You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team including other researchers, product designers, content writers, product managers, engineers, and business partners who share your passion for delivering unique and innovative financial digital products and services of all kinds, including payments and related banking experiences.

Help us make a big bank work better for Small and Mid-Sized Businesses. At Chase Payment Solutions, we are on an mission to help businesses around the world get paid easily and make the most of with their money. We are seeking a talented & proven Product Design Lead who can define conception, development and evolution of key payment and banking experiences that help SMBs manage their finances more effectively.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Cloud, Microservices, event-driven systems, containerization are some of the patterns & technologies which are driving the future architecture at JPMC. Doing so in a resilient, performant and secure way are the goals of our team. We, as part of the CCB Architecture and Engineering organization are on the forefront of maturing these patterns/technologies by applying them to solve complex production use cases. We look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. We embrace an open culture of ownership, experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning.
Our team operates with a \"start-up\" mentality and takes pride in owning an objective to completion. If you are enthusiastic about being part of the firm's modernization journey and transformation, this position may be a good fit for you.
As a senior cloud engineer on our team, you will engineer & lead large-scale migrations of existing complex workloads to cloud platforms, on-prem and public. You will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mindshare, introduce intelligence via AI/ML, and broad adoption of cloud-based solutions across Consumer Banking products. The ability to connect modern engineering practices and methodologies with measurable business value is critical to a senior cloud engineer.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
What will you do?
Develop cutting edge AI/ML Platform solutions using public cloud hybrid architecture and modern standards and patterns.
Integrate with AWS Cloud Services for compute, storage, databases, and security.
Develop solutions or tools to monitor, provision components for automation of the processes, services and reports
Leverage strong operational skills to develop impactful recommendations on upstream product, process, or policy improvements that will optimize the user experience.
Work closely with the Product team to design, build and deliver capabilities in agile sprints.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
JPMC is seeking experienced AI Engineers to join our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning group in Cyber Technology Controls (CTC). The group is focused on applying state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence (AL), Machine Learning (ML), Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Deep Learning (DL) technologies to accelerate and innovate advanced AI and ML capabilities for detecting and mitigating cyber threats, both current and emerging.
This is a very exciting opportunity for any AI Engineer which empowers you using cutting edge technology to utilize artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms for cyber security threat detection and mitigation at scale.

Your Role
Closely collaborate with subject matter experts (SME) in Cyber Technology Group
Mine and analyze data from JPMC data sources and assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
JPMorgan Chase and CCB Data & Analytics has a strategic business goal to run applications on multi-cloud environments and deliver innovative solutions using AI/ML, big data, devops tools and microservices and architectures. This role is responsible for driving the development of Chase Consumer and Community Banking's (CCB) Vocabulary.

We are looking for a candidate with experience building semantic data architecture to join our CCB Vocabulary team to assist in taxonomy and ontology efforts for a new team within JPMC. You will have the opportunity create a large scale Vocabulary, which will be applied to data at hyper scale, making them both human and machine readable for our data consumers and our data scientists. With CCB's comprehensive data, we are setting out to build knowledge graphs to facilitate better insights discovery, search, and knowledge management and governance.
We are looking for a candidate with experience building semantic data systems to join our CCB Vocabulary team. You will have the opportunity create and use a large scale Vocabulary, which will be applied to data at hyper scale, making the data both human and machine readable for our data consumers and our data scientists. The key purpose of this role is the ability to create high quality prototypes with which to demonstrate the Vocabulary

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Machine Learning Center of Excellence - Applied AIML Associate (Data Annotation)

The mission of the AI Transformation & Engagements team is to enable at-scale development, testing, deployment, and continuous integration and delivery of AI/ML technologies in order to drive fundamental improvement in the quantity and quality of AI training data sets, accelerate AI delivery (measured in days and months), and improve AI performance. Enable a firm wide AI ecosystem with integrated platform, controls, compliance, and responsible AI. Provide the foundation and support for our business partners to consistently deliver AI solutions within targets, and in turn, create next generation market share.

The Machine Learning team at JPMorgan Chase combines cutting edge machine learning techniques with the company's unique data assets to optimize all the business decisions we make. In this role, you will be part of our world-class machine learning team, and work on the collection, annotation and enrichment of data for machine learning models. Our work spans the company's lines of business, with exceptional opportunities in each.

The successful candidate will work on multiple projects and provide data annotation services across a variety of data types including, but not limited to, text, chats, emails and audio. We expect the candidate to understand the business use-case and own the data annotation pipeline to go from the raw data to a reliable, annotated ground truth that can be used by sophisticated machine learning methods for banking applications such as risk assessment, trading models, customer relationship management, and pricing models.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Data & Analytics - Data & Knowledge Engineer

JPMorgan Chase has a strategic business goal to run applications on multi-cloud environments and deliver innovative solutions using AI/ML, big data, develops tools and micro-services and architectures. This role is responsible for driving the strategy and execution of Chase Consumer and Community Banking's (CCB) data strategy and operating model.

As an experienced data product management professional, you are very familiar with product management best practices across the lifecycle and can transform how a firm delivers superior customer experiences through their product and service offerings. You are very comfortable with influencing key stakeholders in analytics, business and technology to deliver leading edge innovation with the customer and the business impact in mind. You are comfortable with data and technology trends and their implications.

We are looking for a candidate with experience building data ontologies to join our CCB Data Delivery team to drive adoption of common vocabularies and structured data within the Firm. You will have the opportunity to partner with our Data Publishers making their data scalable and machine-readable for our data consumers and data scientists when building NLP/ML/AI solutions. With CCB's comprehensive data, we are setting out to build knowledge graphs to facilitate better insights discovery, search, and knowledge management and governance.


An influential data-centric business role within a fast-growing area. Broad scope to design and specify meta-data and data products for CCB. We expect you to be highly interested in financial services industry and have understanding of different banking products and services.


In this exciting role we expect you to lead the work in applying structured data methods and technologies, generate ontologies and vocabularies that describe our data. The meta-data and data should be discoverable via human and machine search using APIs to support data-driven decision tools and processes such as MIS, advanced analytics, including graph databases.

You will partner with product managers and technology to output data for our business users (both non-technical and technical). You will be a key person in shaping the product offering and the customer experience.

The role must demonstrate the following:





CCB Data & Analytics

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Applied AI & ML Senior Associate - Fintech Venture within Corporate & Investment Bank

Build The Future of Banking using Data Science, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning

We are building the AI / Machine Learning future of banking within a high-profile and exciting new fintech business for the firm.

Benefit from:
a fast paced, can-do AI culture of a startup
with the benefit of the backing and stability of the largest bank in the world.

We work with the smartest people, who are willing to break down walls of what is possible leveraging the latest advances in artificial intelligence.

The small, and fast growing, cross-disciplinary team building the product brings together AI experts, data scientists, data engineers, finance specialists, former entrepreneurs, product managers, and designers.

We are looking for individuals to help us develop and bring existing data- and AI-focused projects to the next level. Someone, while aware that data projects are hard work, is passionate and experienced to work with a wide array of datasets to gain deep insights into private markets and make actionable recommendations.







J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader in Banking. The world's corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Corporate & Investment Bank supports our clients around the world providing strategic advice, raising capital and managing risk. In January 2022, J.P. Morgan announced a renewed focus on investing in, and building out of, data-driven initiatives.


The Digital Private Markets business is a fast-growing global team within J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank. We are creating a high-profile and exciting new fintech business for the firm, focused on early-stage private markets. This cross-functional business leverages the scale, network and data of JPM to create holistic solutions for private companies and their investors. Their first product, Capital Connect, is a members-only platform for start-ups and every type of investor. This platform will allow members to network with other members, benchmark companies using proprietary data, consume exclusive content and raise/invest capital on a seamless platform. This cross-functional team operates like a true start-up within the larger company. As an integral part of our team, you will need to demonstrate the curiosity, passion and tenacity required to build a start-up and to solve complex problems in the largest investment bank in the world. If you are excited to make a difference and want to transform private capital markets, this is the place for you.



While the primary location is in New York, we are open to different JPM locations within the US.



Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist/ML Engineer to join our technology team to solve exciting business problems in the domain of commercial banking, payments and financial services. Candidates must have a strong curiosity for data and a proven track record of successfully applying rigorous scientific methods with proficiency in ML Engineering and DevOps capabilities. This is a unique opportunity to apply your skills and have a direct impact on global business.

The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of ML, NLP, Deep Learning, Knowledge Graphs and have experience working with massive amounts of data. They should also have strong software engineering skills and the ability to build systems that reach JP Morgan scale.

What You'll Do:
Build and train production grade ML models on large-scale datasets to solve various business use cases for Commercial Banking.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
The mission of the AI Transformation & Engagements team is to enable at-scale development, testing, deployment, and continuous integration and delivery of AI/ML technologies in order to drive fundamental improvement in the quantity and quality of AI training data sets, accelerate AI delivery (measured in days and months), and improve AI performance. Enable a firmwide AI ecosystem with integrated platform, controls, compliance, and responsible AI. Provide the foundation and support for our business partners to consistently deliver AI solutions within targets, and in turn, create next generation market share.

What you will be doing:
Lead the implementation of test infrastructure and best practices that enable ML and Data engineers to test and deploy scalable, reliable, and cost-effective code and models into production.
Build a test-driven data science and engineering culture that drives improvements in quality and reliability.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
JPMorgan Chase & Co. views data as central to its strategy. Two strategic objectives underpin our ability to use data to drive competitive advantage:
Transition all data and analytics capabilities to the cloud
Modernize data by adopting linked data on the web best practices (e.g., modern structured formats (JSON, XML, etc.), linked, machine-readable metadata)

CCB Data Lake is a platform product within Chase that plays a foundational role in achieving these objectives. The Lake platform enables publishers to easily onboard and publish their data (or links to data) in the cloud. The platform then uses a mesh architecture to enable data consumers to seamlessly access data from any publisher. Though the product is called CCB Data Lake, it's remit goes beyond delimited batch files. From text to video, batch to streaming, the full spectrum of media types and latency is in scope for the Lake.

The Lake platform went live on the cloud in Q2'2022 and is now in the steep portion of its maturity curve building out features and migrating data from legacy on premise systems to the Lake. to support the Lake's Product Manager and Area Product Owners as we mature. Focus areas will change over time but initial efforts will be targeted at enabling end-to-end capabilities for modern, linked data.



Be a key contributor to one of the highest priority business objectives of Chase. Build a network within Chase by engaging with a broad set of users, stakeholders, and engineers to understand critical needs and constraints. Showcase your creativity and product management skill defining product solutions and working with our technology teams to deliver capabilities.



In this exciting role, you will drive product roadmap development for key capabilities we are delivering within the Lake. Initially, you will support our Product Manager and Area Product Owners but over time we expect you partner directly with users, stakeholders, and our technology teams to lead end-to-end definition and delivery for larger and more complex features.

The successful candidate with demonstrate the following:

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Role: As full-stack software engineer you will develop a product that processes roughly 50M messages through Flink a day from our bots, and then stores the messages in a Cassandra/JanusGraph big data store. From there we build models using Python/OmniAI and then serve up insights via java micro-services or use them for anomaly detection in our Flink jobs. We also have a UI that uses an internal Micro-UI framework. We have plans to be 95% in the cloud by 2021. This is a full-stack developer position, and you will be expected to develop 70% and support/improve your own components when they break 30%. We have no ops team - our litmus test is that we should be able to go on vacation for 6 months - and our bots and services should autonomously continue to operate and also keep themselves up to date.
Desired Qualifications:
Proficiency in Java 8 and AngularJS (or some other Javascript UI framework)
Resourceful, persistent, and motivated with a passion for quality programming and testing
Eager to learn, design, and collaborate to create runnable, testable features
Customer-first: always developing features with the customer in mind
Proactive problem solver and investigator
End to end, T-shaped developer: willing to talk to customers, gather requirements, refine your own backlog, develop amazing features, and deliver them to customers
Experience building/maintaining APIs and Micro Services leveraging Spring framework, Spring Boot, Gaia/Cloud Foundry
Experience working on a full stack application
Keen interest in autonomous automation - where bots simulate human interactions with machine intelligence

Manage existing product features and actively lead the research, definition, and development of enhancements to advance the product's performance
Maximize product value by measuring customer outcomes against objectives and key results
Partner with user research and business/operations teams to analyze and improve customer experience


Preferred: Experience working in or with customer s

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
J.P. Morgan Payments is among the world's largest, most trusted and innovative full-service providers in one of the most dynamic and rapidly transforming spaces in financial services. In addition to providing international cash management, liquidity, commercial card, FX, escrow solutions, merchant services and trade finance, we continue to invest in future-growth initiatives, such as blockchain, AI & ML, as well as form partnerships with rising fintechs to expand our client base and product offerings.

Boasting more than 135,000 clients in over 180 countries, J.P. Morgan Payments offers specialized solutions that provide operating efficiencies and value beyond other standardized solutions available in the market. Our global product and technology platform, integrated client service model and network of operational centers enable J.P. Morgan Payments to deliver a consistent set of services to clients no matter where they are across the world

JP Morgan's Payments - Merchant Services is the global payment processing business for JPMorgan Chase & Co and the world's leading merchant acquirer with over $1+ trillion in annual transaction volume. Merchant Services is a leading provider of payment, fraud and data security for companies large and small and capable of authorizing transactions in more than 130 currencies. JP Morgan's Payments is investing in a global leadership position in the rapidly evolving payments landscape with an aggressive transformation agenda. This multi-year, firm-wide strategy will build customer-centric payments solutions for small businesses. It's a unique opportunity to build a modern product suite based on fully digital with "customer first" approach. In addition, the Agile operating model aligns product owners, designers, engineers and testers to rapidly bring-to-market new product features.

To help drive the transformation, JPMorgan Chase is seeking a proven Senior Product Analyst Lead for the SMB POS Payments team. This role will be hands-on role to perform the business validation tests for all Global SMB POS products, across hardware, web and mobile applications. In addition to testing, this role will help drive the maturity of the testing organization.

This position requires a strong self-starter, who can proactively engage a virtual, cross organizational team with limited formal direction, and who has great level interpersonal skills such as influence management, empathy to customers and analytical/problem solving skills. You will be responsible to follow a scalable, repeatable process to perform validation leveraging simulated test merchants to perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Production Validation Test (PVT) for Global SMB POS products.

Also, help create quality test environments and test data for testers to use for SMB needs of the business. This will include coordinating resources across one or more product teams, test planning, test data preparation, test execution, defect management, preparing and presenting progress reports for management, collecting, documenting and archiving all required testing artifacts for internal audits.

This position will play a key role in efforts to improve testing automation for SMB products. This will not only include the initial build out of the automation capabilities, but also training the organization on utilizing the automation toolset.

This "customer first" candidate will help deliver a robust product end to end test plan and test scripts using expertise in SDLC, customer & client experience, SQA and Agile delivery. The ideal candidate understands modern technology stacks (Mobile Apps, Web experiences, API integrations, Microservices, etc.), design thinking (client journey, UX / UI, moments of truth), and importance of creating unified customer experiences across different channels.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
About Our Client:
We power innovation in the digital economy by providing fintech and digital asset innovators with financial infrastructure. Through a full suite of APIs, we help clients build seamlessly, launch quickly, and scale securely. Regulated by the State of Nevada, we processes hundreds of millions of API calls and settles billions of transactions per month. Our team has extensive regulatory and financial services backgrounds from the OCC, SEC, Federal Reserve, US Department of Justice, US Treasury/Secret Service, JPMorgan Chase, Green Dot, American Express, PNC, Bank of America, and Visa. The company is recognized by Forbes as Americas Best Startup Employer 2022 and is also Great Place to Work Certified 2022. We have also been named to CB Insights Blockchain 50 for 2022.

Title: Product Manager
Job_Description:
About Prime Trust
Prime Trust provides financial infrastructure APIs that allow fintech and digital asset companies to innovate quickly, securely, and reliably. Prime Trust makes it easy for businesses to offer access to digital assets with qualified custody, payment rails, indemnity, liquidity, compliance, and settlement APIs, as well as debit cards for custodial spending. Regulated by the State of Nevada, Prime Trust processes hundreds of millions of API calls per month. Prime Trust's team has extensive regulatory and financial services backgrounds from the OCC, SEC, Federal Reserve, US Department of Justice, US Treasury/Secret Service, JPMorgan Chase, Green Dot, American Express, PNC, Bank of America, and Visa. The company is recognized by Forbes as America's Best Startup Employer 2022 and is also Great Place to Work-Certified 2022. Prime Trust has also been named to CB Insights Blockchain 50 for 2022. Visit us at www.primetrust.com and connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Chase UK- NYC

2023 TECH CONNECT PROGRAM FULL-TIME
About JPMorgan Chase & Co.

Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, including your resume and location preference. It's important to complete all questions so we have as much information about you as possible.

After you submit your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step, you will receive an email invitation to complete a HackerRank assessment and HireVue video interview. The goal of the coding assessment is obtain a better understanding of your current programing knowledge and approach to problem solving and the video interviews are an opportunity to further bring your resume to life by showcasing your skills and experience.

Both HackerRank and HireVue are required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed these steps. We strongly encourage that you complete these required steps as soon as possible, since locations will close as positions are filled.

JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.



At JPMorgan Chase, we're creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career.

We value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to start your career on a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Chase UK- NYC

About Prime Trust
Prime Trust provides financial infrastructure APIs that allow fintech and digital asset companies to innovate quickly, securely, and reliably. Prime Trust makes it easy for businesses to offer access to digital assets with qualified custody, payment rails, indemnity, liquidity, compliance, and settlement APIs, as well as debit cards for custodial spending. Regulated by the State of Nevada, Prime Trust processes hundreds of millions of API calls per month. Prime Trust's team has extensive regulatory and financial services backgrounds from the OCC, SEC, Federal Reserve, US Department of Justice, US Treasury/Secret Service, JPMorgan Chase, Green Dot, American Express, PNC, Bank of America, and Visa. The company is recognized by Forbes as America's Best Startup Employer 2022 and is also Great Place to Work-Certified 2022. Prime Trust has also been named to CB Insights Blockchain 50 for 2022. Title: Senior Software Engineer - Chase UK- NYC
Job_Description:
This is a remote position and we're considering candidates in the US, UK, Sweden, Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands.
About the role:
We are looking for an Engineering Manager to help us grow and develop our Cloud Platform team. Our managers take an active role in creating a productive environment for our engineers; be it through removing blockers and impediments, facilitating cross-team collaboration and understanding, or by aiding the team in helping themselves by constantly improving and refining their working practices. Youll be responsible for managing a team of distributed engineers working across a variety of systems and helping them to perform at their best.
Our Grafana Cloud pipeline moves millions of data points, log lines and traces per second from our customer's environments into a highly available, low-latency stack that processes and stores the data, and serves it to dashboards and alerting tools. We aim to grow this to hundreds of millions per second, and it's critical that as we grow, we improve our performance, increase our reliability and do it all more efficiently.

Company

Campbell Global, a J.P. Morgan Chase company, is a leading global investment manager focused on forestland. We are widely recognized as an authority on both forest management and timberland investing. The Senior Systems Engineer's core responsibilities are to ensure adequate availability and reliability of IT services, assets, and systems throughout the firm; to ensure that the firm is secure and protected through the development and implementation of superior redundancy, performance, resiliency, back-up, business continuity and disaster recovery plans; and, to implement IT policies. Title: Senior Software Engineer - Chase UK- NYC
Job_Description:
Do you like to engineer large scale mission critical solutions that are Always On? Do you like to contribute where cutting edge software development, global scale system architecture and enterprise systems administration intersect? Are you curious about how things break, so that you can eliminate these failure modes? Are you driven to eliminate toil by designing/adopting better tools and automation techniques? If so, we would love to have you in our Production Engineering team.
The Production Engineer is a technical Subject Matter Expert that pro-actively drives the technical stability and performance of the applications in the Chase global technology portfolio. They combine software and systems engineering to design solutions in physical, virtual and cloud environments that automate fault detection, containment, and resolution without customer impact or human intervention. These solutions typically involve software development for metrics and event collection/correlation across distributed architectures, automation, monitoring, intelligent alerting, random fault injection, and self-healing.








Our Consumer & Community Banking Group depends on innovators like you to serve nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities and non-profits. And best of all, you'll be able to harness massive amounts of brainpower through our global network of technologists from around the world to tackle big challenges.

As a Mainframe DB2 Infrastructure Developer, you'll play a big part in designing the platforms, servers, and networks that make it possible for us to provide service to our customers, clients, and businesses around the globe each and every day. Title: J.P. Morgan Wealth Management - VP, Credit Product Delivery Manager
Job_Description:
J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. is a leading global financial services firm with assets of more than $2.7 trillion, over 240,000 employees and operations in over 60 countries. It operates across four business segments including Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate and Investment Banking, Commercial Banking and Consumer and Community Banking.

J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits.

J.P. Morgan Private Bank advises the world's wealthiest families and helps them achieve their desired goals. Our teams of Advisors deliver advice, solutions and services across investments, wealth planning, credit and banking to help clients build, preserve and manage their wealth over time.

The U.S. Private Bank advises families across the U.S. through 45 offices and represents one of the largest growth opportunities for J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. In 2019, the U.S. Private Bank was recognized by Euromoney as the #1 Private Bank Overall in North America.



As a Private Banker in the Private Bank, you are responsible for advising families on building, preserving and managing their wealth. You will use your knowledge of investments, financial planning, credit and banking to both advise current clients on all aspects of their balance sheet and drive new client acquisition. You will be part of a local team and supported by an institutional platform that has the resources, specialists and intellectual capital to help you advise clients on achieving their desired goals.

The best Private Bankers are self-starters with a proven track record of success. They are skilled problem solvers who offer specialized advice to clients. For those with an entrepreneurial spirit, a tenacity to succeed and a passion for delivering world class service to our clients, this role is an exciting opportunity to further build your career.

Our culture of performance, transparency and partnership is driven by objective, transparent goals and active teamwork to foster Advisor success. We are committed to helping you grow at all stages of your career.

The ReEntry Program is a 15-week fellowship program, beginning March 20, 2023 and ending June 30, 2023, with the prospect of an offer for permanent employment with JP Morgan Chase at the end of the program. The program offers a reintroduction to corporate life for those returning to the workplace after an extended career break for two or more years. The fellowship placements will be based on both business needs and candidate skill set and interest areas within our Corporate Investment Banking, Asset Wealth Management & Commercial Banking Operations business.

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

Title: J.P. Morgan Wealth Management - VP, Credit Product Delivery Manager
Job_Description:
The JPMorgan Wealth Management business is focused on helping investors achieve their long-term financial goals and comprised of the Chase Wealth Management business, J.P. Morgan Securities and J.P. Morgan Self-Directed Investing-our digital investing platform. The combined business has ~$400 billion in Assets under Management and ~4,000 advisors who work out of 3,500 branches and 21 offices.

As a member of the Client Welcome Group, a Client Development Professional, you will actively engage with prospective clients through a variety of customer interactions, identifying new investment and advice opportunities and driving business development. A Client Development Professional will be a part of a collaborative team environment with the goal of understanding client investment needs, educating clients on the products and services available to them, and guiding clients as they select appropriate investment advice channels. Client Development professionals will have a solid understanding of financial markets and the ability to effectively simplify financial concepts, building rapport and credibility with prospective clients. Through focused, investigative, and inquisitive conversations you will help to uncover business opportunities to introduce and promote our products, services, and tools ultimately leading to client conversion and action. This enhanced discovery approach to doing business will help build and instill trust and loyalty, reaffirming the client's choice to invest with JPMorgan.

As part of the Client Welcome Group a successful New Client Development Professional will engage potential new clients through engaging and consultative conversations. You will be responsible for providing an exceptional client experience by understanding and addressing client service needs as they become new JPMorgan Wealth clients. You will have a passion for business development that will drive and assist our Advisors to convert high quality leads into new clients.

Title: J.P. Morgan Wealth Management - VP, Credit Product Delivery Manager
Job_Description:
As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.
Counterparty Risk consists of the Counterparty Risk, Stress and Margining (CRSM), Central Counterparty (CCP) and Commodities groups within Wholesale Credit Risk, which cover OTC Derivatives (cleared and non-cleared), Futures and Options, Securities financing and Securities Prime Services, CCPs and Commodities. Overall group responsibilities include, but are not limited to Counterparty Risk Measurement, Monitoring (and escalating as appropriate) of those risks/exposures, Ad hoc risk investigations and analyses for credit officers, sales and senior management, Assessment of CSA terms adequacy, Determination of initial margin requirements including corresponding eligible collateral and valuations where applicable, Ownership and maintenance of all credit exposure metrics (continuous adequacy assessment), All related exposure calculation/reporting engines and their development agendas and priorities, and Credit Capital & CCAR/ICAAP related exposure & collateral stress testing.

Title: J.P. Morgan Wealth Management - VP, Credit Product Delivery Manager
Job_Description:
Position Description

The WM US Credit Risk team is seeking an Associate / Vice President to support Senior Credit Officers who manage credit exposure for Wealth Management clients, with a primary focus on credit risk management for derivatives. It is a global priority for the WM Credit Risk team to develop and oversee a derivatives center of excellence to extend, centralize, and strengthen our risk coverage of derivative trading products. The candidate will play an integral role in this program and will also have the opportunity to manage credit relationships for a diverse portfolio of clients and products in addition to derivatives including securities-based lending, structured lending / specialty lending, and mortgages .

Responsibilities
Act as subject matter expert on counterparty credit risk exposure for Wealth Management clients, with a primary focus on derivatives (across all asset classes) to help guide methodology and policy updates and provide advice to other Credit Officers and front office teams (WM Solutions, Investment Specialists, Lending Specialists, Client Advisors/Bankers)

CCOR Business Resiliency & Physical Security Risk Executive Director - This role reports to the Head of CCOR Resiliency Risk and works across the 1st and 2nd Lines of Defense to coordinate global, strategic risk oversight of the business resiliency and physical security risk and control environments at JP Morgan Chase. The role requires a leader with in-depth understanding of operational risk management and control including those related to business, technology and third party resiliency domains, physical security and crisis management. The role must work collaboratively inspiring and empowering the resiliency risk team and other CCOR and Line of Defense partners to manage operational risks impacting the firm's physical security and business resiliency operating environment. The incumbent will work with other specialist areas to provide effective assessment and challenge of risk, and informed consultation.

The role will:
Lead a team of 2nd Line of Defense operational risk managers responsible for providing oversight and challenge to the Firmwide Business Resiliency Team, Global Security and Crisis Management Teams.

The successful candidate will prepare and deliver written and verbal communications on risk and control assessment results to senior audiences within the firm. The role requires a strong self-starter, leader and manager who can identify and implement strategic program objectives, understand risks and the associated mitigating resiliency controls using a consistent, logical approach to independently assess and challenge the 1LOD operational resiliency and business resiliency environment.


Solution-oriented mindset, excellent communication, interpersonal and stakeholder management skills

How You Will Fulfill Your Potential
Seeking a full-stack engineer to assist in building the strategic liquidity risk management infrastructure for one of the largest financial institution in the country.
The target platform will process daily several millions transactions and positions, calculate risk presented by the current actual as well as model-based future states of the market, and provide ability to analyze the profile in real time.
This is a great opportunity for engineers who want to work on building cloud native platforms from the ground up. Engineers will work on building the next generation distributed systems as well as modern reporting architecture. Title: Senior Software Engineer - Chase UK- NYC
Job_Description:
We are looking for an energetic, technology-minded controls officer to help us drive cloud control designs and provide risk and controls support for the application stack that supports data warehousing consumption in the public cloud. This Information Security Management (ISM) role supports the Data & Analytics functions, including Data Science, regulatory reporting, and operational reporting, with a focus on controls to protect customer data.

At Chase, the ISMs perform the role of a "CISO" for their assigned businesses. They are trusted Risk Advisors who hold key positions within business leadership, enabling them to provide advice and ensuring the firm has the right Cybersecurity and Technology controls to meet its risk appetite. They help teams design great products that meet the needs of both the client and the firm.

In the role, you will partner with fellow ISMs and your aligned technology teams in security controls-focused interlock discussions across technology departments (e.g. software development teams, Chief Technology Office, and Global Technology Infrastructure) in support of cloud adoption, vulnerability management, regulatory & internal policy compliance, and controls-related process improvements. You will partner with subject matter experts across multiple technology domains, helping them design and communicate their controls within the public cloud to appropriately meet the control obligations of the firm to protect customer data, while enabling the business to make decisions using cloud technologies.

Data warehousing functions at the firm include, but are not limited to, data science, machine learning, reporting functions, ad hoc analytics, data governance and management - such as data classification and registration capabilities, business and technical data quality capabilities, business and technical metadata management and the appropriate usage of either type, and record retention and destruction implementation. Working knowledge of data warehousing concepts like ETL, data quality, big data, S3, Kubernetes, and/or design of user access models is required.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Chase UK- NYC
Job_Description:
The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group (CTC) at JPMorgan Chase brings security to new and enhanced products which serve and are trusted by millions of customers. The group proactively and strategically partners with all of JPMC's Consumer and Community Banking lines of business. As part of this group, you will help teams design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group's number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable, and resilient.
Job Description

JPMC's Consumer and Community Banking organization is currently transforming core services to leverage new and leading cloud technologies. Because of the immense criticality of the services we provide, security is a critical component of what we do and the changes we are making. Come join a highly skilled team driving the creation of services scaled to support millions of people and secure enough to face persistent cyber-attacks. We are looking for energetic, cloud technology-minded security architects to help find the best security solutions and partner with project architecture teams to make those solutions a foundational part of the product design.

The Cybersecurity Architecture team within the CTC organization ensures JPMC's consumer and investment services are able to effectively detect, prevent, and respond to cyber threats against our technology and services. The scope of Cybersecurity architecture comprises designs supporting detection and monitoring of threats and vulnerabilities, managing security incidents, and supporting our security infrastructure to keep ahead of threats against the system from all level of cyber-attacks. We accomplish this through strong information security leadership and active collaboration with line of business information risk managers to provide high quality security solutions and services that are focused on improving the Firm's risk posture.

Cyber Security Architects are strong technologists with a pragmatic view and creative mind. Ideal candidates are natural collaborators with software architects, software engineers, business product owners and senior management. The Architect is expected to lead through influence, communicate effectively with clarity of thought and demonstrated understanding of business and technical requirements.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Chase UK- NYC
Job_Description:
Cyber Security & Technology Controls (CTC) purpose is to ensure the security and resiliency of the firm's computing environment, protect customer and employee confidential information, and comply with regulatory requirements globally. We accomplish this through strong information security leadership and active collaboration with line of business information risk managers to provide high quality security solutions and services that are focused on improving the firm's risk posture. The Cyber Range team is composed of firm-wide functions (Cyber Range Training Platform (CRTP), Cyber Red Team (CRT), Attack Analyses (AA), Operational Assessment Pentest, Vulnerability Management Operations and Cyber Range Engineering teams) as well as business-aligned risk & resiliency management teams that affect the technology risk program across JPMC.

The successful candidate will be a strong technologist who is flexible, resilient, an innovative thinker, as well as a natural collaborator with enterprise architects, engineers, developers, and senior management from across the organization. Systems Engineering Team Lead is expected to lead and promote future proof cost effective architecture enabling resiliency/agility within our global technology products. In addition, the candidate must possess strong technical leadership skills, the ability to influence at all levels of the organization, demonstrated success in working with teams particularly with peer technology stakeholders/customers/clients, and communicate effectively through clarity of thought and demonstrate understanding of business and technical requirements.



About Us

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

About the Team

The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm's cybersecurity, access management, controls, and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group's number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable, and resilient.

High Risk Roles (HRR) are sensitive roles within the technology organization that require high assurance of the integrity of staff by virtue of 1) sensitive cybersecurity and technology functions they perform within systems or 2) information they receive regarding sensitive cybersecurity or technology matters. Users in these roles are subject to enhanced pre-hire screening which includes both criminal and credit background checks (as allowed by law). The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.

Title: Data Scientist | Vice President | Investment | Asset Wealth Management
Job_Description:
The Data Analyst Specialist is an integral role in Data Governance and is responsible for gathering and documenting metadata for data elements related to critical business operation processes, data quality and reporting. Certified data will be used for remediation, external board reporting, as well as policy and process implementations.
The Data Analyst Specialist will help improve data quality and consistency and support program data certification requirements by analyzing process controls and root cause, coordinating activities to support problem resolution, and developing metrics to support processes, as needed.
Data Stewards are guardians and decision makers for specific data elements related to metadata and data quality. Data Stewards are responsible for understanding metadata, usage, standards and quality for specific data elements. Data Management also controls access to data based on the understanding of the data, setting parameters known as Protection Groups that grant differing levels of access to critical data such as personal, account, authenticators, and privacy data.

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

Within this organization, the Decision Sciences team leverages industry-leading data-driven techniques to convert data into meaningful insights that enable the firm to drive value and an outstanding customer experience.

The wealth management industry is rapidly changing and JPMorgan Chase is transforming our U.S. wealth management business to accelerate growth. We are looking for a talented analyst to help inform our strategy across a newly combined JPMorgan Wealth Management (JPMWM) business unit that includes our Chase Wealth Management, JP Morgan Advisors, Personal Advisors, and Online Investing platforms. This is a producing manager role that will also require hands-on work - so we're looking for exceptionally creative, ambitious, \"data curious\" thinkers who can help extract true business value from data and develop their team to do the same.

Title: Python/AWS - Big Data Engineer
Job_Description:
How You Will Fulfill Your Potential
Seeking a full-stack engineer to assist in building the strategic liquidity risk management infrastructure for one of the largest financial institution in the country.
The target platform will process daily several millions transactions and positions, calculate risk presented by the current actual as well as model-based future states of the market, and provide ability to analyze the profile in real time.
This is a great opportunity for engineers who want to work on building cloud native platforms from the ground up. Engineers will work on building the next generation distributed systems as well as modern reporting architecture. The platform will utilize massively computing platform with ability to scale horizontally, partitioning and pipelining, modern in-memory, non-relational data management principles, and will be completely cloud native.
Lead the design, development, and on-going support for cloud-native applications and services; this includes guiding and mentoring junior engineers, performing code reviews, managing pull requests, managing incident resolutions, etc

This team is building data ontologies to drive the adoption of common vocabularies and structured data across the firm as we move our data to AWS.

Title: 2023 AI & Data Science Full Time Analyst
Job_Description:
The Data Analyst Specialist is an integral role in Data Governance and is responsible for gathering and documenting metadata for data elements related to critical business operation processes, data quality and reporting. Certified data will be used for remediation, external board reporting, as well as policy and process implementations.
The Data Analyst Specialist will help improve data quality and consistency and support program data certification requirements by analyzing process controls and root cause, coordinating activities to support problem resolution, and developing metrics to support processes, as needed.
Data Stewards are guardians and decision makers for specific data elements related to metadata and data quality. Data Stewards are responsible for understanding metadata, usage, standards and quality for specific data elements. Data Management also controls access to data based on the understanding of the data, setting parameters known as Protection Groups that grant differing levels of access to critical data such as personal, account, authenticators, and privacy data.

Title: 2023 AI & Data Science Full Time Analyst
Job_Description:
Experimentation- Product Data Analyst, Assoc.

Location New York, NY or Wilmington, DE

Chase is undertaking an aggressive digital transformation agenda, which builds on the success of the current mobile and online service offerings. The ambition is to position Chase as the undisputed leader in digital financial services and experimentation plays a big role in achieving that goal.

The Digital Experimentation team is a COE and product group of the Experimentation and Feature Flag Platforms. Our objective is to empower teams to use Experimentation as a foundation for decision making; to improve the performance of core flows and remove guesswork from launch and enhancement decisions.

The associate will collaborate both internally and externally to design, execute and analyze experiments. This includes aligning with stakeholders on KPIs to effectively measure changes, complete QA of technical instrumentation, monitor health of the experiment post-launch, assess statistical significance, and perform post-test analyses (top level and deep dive, as required). They will be expected to go beyond descriptive analytics, explore all available data points to explain and recommend the next steps. The role will also be expected to help the team summarize key findings across all tests and report up & out in a polished fashion.
